### Problem

I am trying to build neovim `stable` on Ubuntu 20.04, so I follow https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/Building-Neovim#build-prerequisites.

However, when running `cmake ..`:

```
-- CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr/local
-- CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
-- Replacing -O3 in CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELEASE with -O2

/usr/bin/luajit: module 'mpack' not found:

/usr/bin/lua5.1: module 'mpack' not found:
	no field package.preload['mpack']

stack traceback:

	[C]: ?

/usr/bin/lua: module 'mpack' not found:
	no field package.preload['mpack']

stack traceback:
	[C]: ?

-- [/usr/bin/lua] The 'mpack' lua package is required for building Neovim
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:187 (message):
  Failed to find a Lua 5.1-compatible interpreter
```

I had to `sudo luarocks install mpack` to get around this.

Then the next issue is that it would not find libuv
```
CMake Error at /usr/local/share/cmake-3.24/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:230 (message):
  Could NOT find Libluv (missing: LIBLUV_LIBRARY LIBLUV_INCLUDE_DIR)
  (Required is at least version "1.43.0")
```

I have installed the current master of libuv in `/usr/local`, but apparently the cmake integration does not find it, presumable because it's looking for the wrong name
```
  find_library called with the following settings:

    VAR: LIBLUV_LIBRARY
    NAMES: "luv_a"
           "luv"
           "libluv_a"
           "luv.so"
```
and not `uv`.

Possibly this is also a cmake version problem? (3.24.1)

Anyway, are there build instructions for ubuntu 20.04 somewhere or is this considered an unsupported system?


### Steps to reproduce

clone neovim
mkdir build; cd build
cmake ..

### Expected behavior

Neovim compiles with the documented build requisites installed.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

7d4bba7aa7a4a3444919ea7a3804094c290395ef

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS

### Terminal name/version

iTerm2

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color inside ssh

### Installation

from source

comment_data.body: <https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/Building-Neovim#build-prerequisites> doesn't contain anything related to your steps. Are you trying to link <https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/Building-Neovim#third-party-dependencies>?

title: Incomplete build instructions?
